intro: Weinmannia mariquitae, commonly known as the Mariquitae weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern South America. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypresses and related conifers. The plant is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and clusters of tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dune environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
